graphicslib3D.shape

Class Teapot

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Shape3D
      • graphicslib3D.shape.Teapot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Teapot
extends Shape3D
    This class defines a Newell Teapot (also known as a "Utah Teapot"). The teapot uses the JOGL GLUT implementation to draw the teapot, and inherits the characteristics of the JOGL implementation.

    The teapot can be rendered in either wireframe or solid mode; use the method Shape3D.setDrawMode(DRAW_MODE) to specify the mode: either Shape3D.DRAW_MODE.WIREFRAME or Shape3D.DRAW_MODE.SOLID. The default draw mode is Shape3D.DRAW_MODE.SOLID.

    The Teapot extends Shape3D and inherits properties from that class; in particular, each Shape3D has a Material and if the Material for the teapot is not null when draw(GLAutoDrawable) is invoked then the material is made current (by invoking Material.makeCurrent(GL2) prior to invoking GLUT to draw the teapot.

    The current transform of the Shape3D is also applied to the OpenGL MODELVIEW matrix prior to drawing the Teapot.

    Author:
    John Clevenger
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Teapot

        public Teapot(double size)
        Define a teapot of scale size. A size of 1.0 produces a teapot centered at the origin with body vertices in the range -1..1.
        Parameters:
        size - -- the scale factor applied to the underlying teapot implementation.

      • Teapot

        public Teapot()
        Define a teapot with a default scale (size) of 1.0.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Description copied from class: Shape3D
        Draws this shape by invoking appropriate OpenGL commands using the specified JOGL GLDrawable object. Subclass implementations of this method should check the object's Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD by invoking Shape3D.getRenderMethod() and should use appropriate OpenGL calls (for example, if the current Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD is Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD.IMMEDIATE then the object should use immediate mode commands (glBegin()/glEnd()) to perform the drawing). Note that subclasses are also responsible for performing attendant operations, such as activating the shape's Material or outputting shader variable values, in their draw() method.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        drawable - the GLAutoDrawable object on which this shape should be drawn.
